title: Lots of delay, but no lag
body:
I just had one of the worst games I ever had (yes, I am a scrubby normals player). 

For whatever reason, I had delay on everything I did in the game. Issuing commands took half a second longer than they should, resulting in me aiming a skillshot the wrong way because I aim it forward, fire it then click behind myself to walk away, but then the skillshot fires backwards. Pinging had the same effect, took about half a second to choose a ping which resulted in the wrong pings being used. 

Another symptom is that every now and then everything would gain a boost of speed, champions even going through walls and stuff.

This was happening in my previous games but its gotten progressively worse. It started when I downloaded the most recent patch.

Basically, it was the effects of lag. But, my ping never went above 50 and my FPS remained at a steady rate of 40 - 50 FPS throughout all of my games. I have heard this is called packet loss, but I'm not exactly sure what it is, nor how to fix it, if it can even be fixed. Would someone be able to help me out here?

Thanks in advance :)  {{summoner:31}}

~Edit - This problem seems to have fixed itself, not sure how but it did :)

replies.body:
Well, packet loss is usually the cause of a high ping. If it was solely that, then you'd find that your ping is erratically going up to near the thousands of milliseconds and back, not just staying steady.

Are you using a VPN by any chance?

Well my ping has been stable, as I said its the delay that is really bugging me.

And no, I am not using a VPN.

Do you use a wireless mouse?

Oh wait, have you recently flushed your DNS?
I have the same problem, anyone help plz
